slider.mainMessage: Empowering innovation through accessible fabrication technology. We provide the tools, space, and expertise to turn ideas into reality.

fablabRoom.title: FabLab Space
fablabRoom.text: Our modern FabLab is equipped with cutting-edge digital fabrication tools and equipment, providing a perfect environment for innovation and creation. From 3D printers to CNC machines, laser cutters to electronics workstations, we offer comprehensive resources for turning ideas into reality.

fabLearn.title: FabLearn Program
fabLearn.text: Join our educational programs to learn digital fabrication skills and bring your ideas to life with hands-on experience and expert guidance. Our curriculum combines theoretical knowledge with practical applications, preparing students for future careers in engineering and technology.

cfyi.title: Center for Youth Initiatives
cfyi.text: A pioneering center in Uzbekistan and the CIS region for advanced engineering education and inventive creativity. Integrates world-class methodologies like FabLabs, CDIOâ„¢, and STEM to develop future engineering professionals, promote gender equality in STEM, and prepare innovators from pre-school to university.

blog.title: Our Blog
blog.subtitle: Insights, updates, and stories from the FabLab Uzbekistan team. Stay informed about the latest innovations and developments in manufacturing.

3d-printing-innovations.title: SLA Resin Printing: Revolutionizing Small-Batch Production for Spare Parts
3d-printing-innovations.author: FabLab Team
3d-printing-innovations.content: In today's manufacturing landscape, there's often a challenging gap between one-off prototyping and full-scale mass production. At our FABLAB, we recently tackled this exact problem for a client who needed a specialized component in quantities that made traditional injection molding impractical. This blog post explores how we leveraged SLA printing technology to deliver a cost-effective small-batch production solution with remarkable efficiency.

challenge.title: The Challenge: When Injection Molding Isn't the Answer
challenge.content: Our client approached us with a small but critical component that needed to be produced in moderate quantities. Traditional injection molding would have required expensive metal mold fabrication, lengthy lead times for tooling, and a minimum order quantity that exceeded their actual needs. These factors made injection molding economically unfeasible for their project. This is where our advanced SLA printing capabilities offered the perfect middle-ground solution.

design-process.title: From Measurement to Model: Precision Design Process
design-process.content: The first step in our process involved precise measurement of the required component. Using digital calipers, we captured all critical dimensions with sub-millimeter accuracy. These measurements were then translated into a detailed CAD model, creating an exact digital replica of the needed part. The client's specifications required a unique balance of material properties: sufficient structural strength, flexibility in specific areas, and consistent black coloration. After extensive testing, we developed a custom resin mixture by combining our flexible and rigid resins at carefully calibrated ratios, then adding black pigment to achieve the desired aesthetic finish.

optimization.title: Optimizing for Production Efficiency
optimization.content: One of the key innovations in our approach was the optimization of support structures. Rather than using the default support settings that would have placed supports across the entire bottom surface, we strategically positioned supports only where structurally necessary. This optimization delivered remarkable improvements in production efficiency: 30% reduction in printing time, 40% reduction in resin consumption, and significantly reduced post-processing labor. We further refined our print settings to balance resolution with production speed, finding the optimal layer height and exposure times that maintained part quality while maximizing throughput.

production.title: The Production Process
production.content: Our streamlined production workflow consisted of: Printing multiple components arranged efficiently on the build platform, thorough cleaning in isopropyl alcohol to remove uncured resin, careful detachment of supports to maintain surface quality, UV post-curing to achieve final material properties, and dimensional verification and functional testing for quality control.

results.title: Results: Manufacturing Agility
results.content: This approach allowed us to deliver the following advantages over traditional manufacturing methods: No tooling costs with elimination of expensive mold fabrication, rapid turnaround as production began immediately after design approval, supply chain flexibility with ability to produce exact quantities as needed, easy implementation of design improvements between batches, and cost-effective small batches that would be prohibitive with injection molding.

conclusion.title: Conclusion: Bridging the Manufacturing Gap
conclusion.content: At our FABLAB, we're continuously pushing the boundaries of what's possible with advanced fabrication technologies. This project demonstrates how SLA printing can bridge the gap between prototyping and mass production, offering a viable manufacturing path for components that would otherwise be caught in the 'too few for injection molding, too many for one-off printing' dilemma. Whether you need replacement parts, small production runs, or specialized components with unique material properties, our optimized SLA printing capabilities offer a solution that combines quality, speed, and cost-effectiveness.

precisionMoulding.title: Precision Plastic Moulding for Small-Batch Excellence
precisionMoulding.description: Transform your spare parts and small-volume production needs with our specialized plastic moulding solutions. Whether you need replacement parts for legacy equipment or small-batch production runs, our advanced moulding technologies deliver consistent quality and precise tolerances. Perfect for manufacturers, maintenance teams, and businesses requiring reliable, cost-effective solutions for quantities from 1 to 1000 units.

spareParts.question: Can you create spare parts for discontinued products?
spareParts.answer: Yes, we specialize in producing spare parts for products that are no longer manufactured or where original replacements are prohibitively expensive. Using our advanced SLA printing and casting techniques, we can recreate parts with high precision from samples, technical drawings, or even create new designs based on your specifications.

slaComparison.question: How does SLA printing compare to traditional metallic molds?
slaComparison.answer: SLA printing offers faster turnaround times and lower costs for small to medium production runs. While traditional metallic molds are better for mass production, our SLA technology provides exceptional detail and precision without the high upfront tooling costs.

productionTime.question: How long does the production process take?
productionTime.answer: The timeline depends on project complexity. Simple parts can be completed in 1-2 days, while complex projects may take 1 week. SLA printing significantly reduces lead times compared to traditional methods, allowing for rapid iterations and faster time-to-market.

limitations.question: What are the limitations of SLA printing for parts?
limitations.answer: While SLA printing offers exceptional detail and quality, it has limitations in terms of material properties and production volume. We'll help you determine if SLA is right for your project or if alternative methods would be more suitable based on your specific requirements and goals.

aboutUs.title: Behind the Innovation
aboutUs.subtitle: Feels modern, fitting for a FabLab with cutting-edge tools.

pioneers.title: Pioneers
pioneers.text: We are proud to be the first official FabLab in Uzbekistan, paving the way for digital fabrication and innovation in the region. Our lab operates under the umbrella of CFYI (Center for Youth Innovation), empowering the next generation of creators and engineers.

globalNetwork.title: Global Network
globalNetwork.text: As part of the worldwide FabLab network, we are connected to a global community of makers, educators, and innovators. The FabLab concept, rooted in open access and knowledge sharing, is transforming local communities across the planet.
globalNetwork.buttonText: Learn more about the FabLab network

mitStandards.title: MIT Standards
mitStandards.text: Our FabLab is built on the original MIT FabLab principles, ensuring that we meet the global standards of innovation, safety, and accessibility established by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

cuttingEdgeTools.title: Cutting-Edge Tools
cuttingEdgeTools.text: Equipped with advanced digital fabrication tools, from high-precision CNCs to industrial-grade 3D printers and laser cutters, we offer unmatched opportunities for prototyping, education, and production.
